results.title: All I Need Is You

constellations_other.name: Now watch this
constellations_other.description: In a video-saturated world, how do you keep focus? Do you keep a close eye on one thing, or step back and watch the parade of images go by, to see the whole thing?

results.description: The music video, directed by Richard Maxwell, by Rab Cantor, off his album Not a Trampoline.
description_for_label: The music video, directed by Richard Maxwell, by Rab Cantor, off his album Not a Trampoline.

images.caption: Still from All I Need Is You, directed by Randall Maxwell

results.title: All I need is a conference
results.creator_credit: Robert Wilmot, Henry Strauss and General Electric
results.brief_description: Illustrates the uses that meetings and conferences can be made to serve, if guided by a trained and competent leader. Shows how the behaviour of people attending meetings is basically affected by the personal concerns they bring with them. Points out that the conference leader can deal successfully with the problem on the table only if he understands how to deal with the people around it. Dramatizes the pitfalls that can beset any meeting and the steps to take in order to avoid them.

results.title: All I desire [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ross Hunter and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Seasoned stage actress, Naomi Murdoch (Barbara Stanwyck), receives a letter from her long lost daughter, Lily (Lori Nelson), inviting her to come and see her star in a local production. After years in the big city, Naomi impulsively decides to return to the small-town where she once lived. Despite the good intentions, Naomi’s return disrupts the small-town life, provoking a myriad of reactions from each family member - from delight to despair - and re-igniting an old flame with a shady character. “All I desire” turns on the divide between city/small-town, female independence/domesticity, recklessness/conformity, with each character embodying either side. The only one torn between the two is Naomi who yearns deeply for the love of her husband and children. However, right at the last minute, the past returns to threaten this promise of happiness and domestic bliss once and for all. “All I desire” is classic melodrama: emotion and desire fills every scene. Douglas Sirk, with producer Ross Hunter, continues in this film his reputation as the master of ‘50s melodrama: expressive use of camera, lighting and performance; total devotion to pangs of the heart and soul, gender and desire, performance and identity and the limits of social convention. At the centre of “All I desire”, however, is Stanwyck’s performance, which shifts from hardened working girl to graceful lady to soft, dear-hearted mother with natural ease. It is a performance that knocks a punch into this film’s underlying theme: the bittersweet notion that in life we often learn things the hard way.

results.title: All dogs go to heaven
results.creator_credit: Don Bluth, John Pomeroy, Gary Goldman and Sullivan Bluth Studios Ireland
results.brief_description: Don Bluth, the acclaimed animator of “An American Tail” transports us into a wonderful world of animals and adventure. Featuring the voices of Burt Reynolds, Dom DeLuise and Loni Anderson. Charlie is a rascal but a hero nevertheless. This canine rogue’s michievious streak gets him into serious trouble until he learns the value of friendship and goodness.

results.title: All around us: radiation
results.creator_credit: Derek Cunningham and Gerard Holdsworth Productions
results.brief_description: Explains radiation, how it was discovered and how it is measured. Considers its applications and possible effects on health. Shows how radiation is used to our benefit in industry, medicine and research.

results.title: All America roses
results.brief_description: Shows how rose growers throughout the United States compete for the label “All-America-Rose” selection. Shows the checking of blooms at test stations where the best roses are brought to perfection; close-up studies of different varieties of roses; the use of roses in landscape gardening and interior decoration. Narrated by Peter Allen.

results.title: All about weightlessness: the astronaut's dilemma
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Dr Heinz Haber uses a specially created cartoon character, Homo-Sapiens-Extrater-Restrialis, to explain the hazards of survival in the strange environment of outer space. Man must become conditioned to living in a state of weightlessness for long periods. Eating presents some new and surprising problems; sleeping will be a unique experience. We do not know how man’s subconscious mind will react to prolonged journeying through space. An excerpt from “Man in space”.

results.title: All about ships
results.creator_credit: George Klein and South Australia. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: An animated film depicting the evolution of ships from the log raft to the development of the nuclear powered vessel. This story of ships includes the early problems of navigation and ship building and portrays human endeavours to improve sea transport in all parts of the world.
